required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Heat-suit Training on Biological and Performance Characteristics in Elite Cyclists
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Heat-suit Training on Training-associated Changes in Hemoglobin Mass, Muscle Characteristics and Endurance Performance in Elite Cyclists

lead_sponsor.agency: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences

clinical_study.source: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of the study is to investigate the effects of five weeks of heat-suit training on training-associated changes in hemoglobin mass, skeletal muscle characteristics and endurance exercise performance in elite cyclists

detailed_description.textblock: Endurance exercise performance depends on a range of determinants, including hemoglobin mass in blood and content of respiratory mitochondria in skeletal muscle. Low-intensity training (LIT) with heat exposure may be beneficial for development of these variables. The purpose of this study is to investigate the effects of five weeks of LIT-training with heat suit (five times a week; 50 min per session) on hemoglobin mass and other blood characteristics in elite cyclists (males and females) compared to a non-heat-suit training control group, including subsequent investigation of the retrograde effects of ~one month of training without heat suit. The study will also investigate the effects of heat-suit training on endurance exercise performance/performance determinants and other muscle biological charateristics, and will investigate the basic characteristics of mitochondrial function and abundances in these highly trained athletes. Training sessions with heat suit (or lack thereof) will complement the habitual training routines of the participants.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study will be conducted as a five-week intervention. In the heat-suit arm, participants will conduct a 50-minute low-intensity cycling session with heat suit five time a week. In the none-heat-suit arm, participants will conduct similar amounts of low-intensity cycling without heat suit. These training sessions will complement the habitual training of the participants. Participants will be allocated into the two arms in a planned randomized manner. In short, participants will be stratified based on baseline performance levels (VO2max), whereby they will be allocated into the two intervention arms in a manner that ensures similar average performance levels between the two arms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin mass measured using CO rebreathing (g)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal oxygen consumption measured during an incremental cycling exercise test to exhaustion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal aerobic power output measured as mean power output during the last minute of an incremental cycling exercise test to exhaustion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Power output at 4 mmol blood lactate concentration measured during an incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Contribution of total energy turnover to power output in the fresh and fatigued state

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Fractional utilization of VO2max measured at 4 mmol blood lactate concentrations measured during an incremental cycling exercise test (with 5 minute steps)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fractional utilization of VO2max (15-minute performance test)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Fractional utilization of VO2max measured during a 15-minute performance test

secondary_outcome.description: Mean power output measured during a 10-second all-out cycling sprint

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean power output measured during a 15-minute all-out cycling test

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance during a 40-minute all-out cycling test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean power output measured during a 40-minute all-out cycling test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal concentric force production measured using a seated leg press test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: RNA abundances in m. vastus lateralis measured using qPCR (e.g. messenger RNA and ribosomal RNA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: The ability of muscle mitochondria (extracted from homogenate; m. vastus lateralis) to consume oxygen in vitro

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Mitochondria content in m. vastus lateralis measured using electron microscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Total RNA content in skeletal muscle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from before the intervention (T0) to immediately after the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Total RNA content in m. vastus lateralis (per unit tissue weight) measured using spectrophotometry

secondary_outcome.description: Blood volume measured using CO rebreathing

secondary_outcome.description: Plasma volume measured using CO rebreathing

other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study completion (daily), an average of five weeks
other_outcome.description: Self-reported training volume measured as time-spent in different exercise intensity zones

other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study completion (daily), an average of five weeks

arm_group.description: Low-intensity endurance training with heat suit
Low-intensity endurance training without heat suit

intervention.description: Participants (elite cyclists) will conduct five 50-minute low-intensity cycling sessions with heat suit per week for five weeks. These sessions will complement their habitual training routines, which will consist of endurance training with intensities at or below lactate threshold. Participants will ingest 100 mg Fe2+ on a daily basis to support de novo synthesis of hemoglobin

Participants (elite cyclists) will conduct low-intensity cycling without heat suit for five weeks (volume- and intensity-matched to the heat-suit arm). Participants will ingest 100 mg Fe2+ on a daily basis to support de novo synthesis of hemoglobin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- VO2max > 65 ml/kg/min (male participants)
- VO2max > 50 ml/kg/min (female participants)
- >7 hours of endurance training per week for the 6 months leading up to the study

facility.name: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences
